currentPeriod.description: Existence of the currentPeriod object indicates that the default mapping of properties to the currentPeriod tab should be overriden.

sectionLabelName.description: The label which will be shown in the UI for the section.  If this value is not passed then the default value is presented in the UI.

totalAmount.description: The amount to show in the main window.  If this amount is not passed then the default property is used.

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

aggregatePeriod.description: Existence of the aggregatePeriod object indicates that the default mapping of properties to the agrregatePeriod tab should be overriden.

sectionLabelName.description: The label which will be shown in the UI for the section.  If this value is not passed then the default value is presented in the UI.

totalAmount.description: The amount to show in the main window.  If this amount is not passed then the default property is used.

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

positionRef.description: Data which provides reference to a position

positionID.description: Position identifier a person may enter time against.

id.description: Is the Identifier of the given instance of an entity.

schemeAgencyName.description: Agency responsible for the maintenance and definition of the identification scheme

payDate.description: Pay Date is the date on which the monies (i.e. payment) are available. ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD. This may be also be passed as YYYY-MM which is the month the payment represents.

payPeriod.description: The Time Period which the pay covers

startDate.description: The start date of the time period

endDate.description: The end date of the time period

netPayAmount.description: The Amount paid after all deductions are taken out

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

grossPayAmount.description: The Amount paid before any deductions are taken out

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

totalHours.description: The total duration in hours for the related pay

earnings.description: Earning represents an instance of a quantity earned for compensation for labor.

earningCodeName.description: Identifies the Hours/Earnings Code. The typeCode attribute is used to further refine the EarningCode with the Hours/Earnings Field Number.

earningAmount.description: The amount of the earning related to this pay period.

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

earningYTDAmount.description: The year to date amount of the earning

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

payPeriodHours.description: Number of hours related to the earning for the pay period.

payRate.description: The amount an individual is paid over time

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

unitTimeCode.description: The units in which the quantity is communicated.

preTaxIndicator.description: Indicates whether deduction is taken pre tax.   If there is no current period earning and only a year to date amount the pre tax indicator is irrelevant and should not be passed.

deductionCategoryDetails.description: A collection of deduction category codes with the corresponding total amounts

deductionCategoryTotalPeriodAmount.description: The total amount deducted in this pay period for deductions belonging to this category.  E.g. all benefit deductions

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

deductionCategoryTotalYTDAmount.description: The year to date total amount for the  deduction category

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

deductions.description: Deduction is an Amount representing an instance of money deducted from a payroll disbursement. A Deduction maybe a Reverse Deduction.  An example of this is the reimbursement of an Expense Report which is added the Disbursement to the Employee after taxes are taken out

codeName.description: The deduction code of the deduction. The code can be user defined or a  statutory deduction.

deductionCategoryCodeName.description: The deduction code of the deduction. The code can be user defined or a  statutory deduction.

deductionAmount.description: The amount of the deduction related to this pay period

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

deductionYTDAmount.description: The year to date amount of the deduction

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

preTaxIndicator.description: Indicates whether deduction is taken pre tax on the current period deduction.  If there is no current period deduction and only a year to date amount the pre tax indicator is irrelevant and should not be passed.

memos.description: Memos are similar to deduction in that they represent a code and an amount, but where they differ is in their effect on the Gross to Net calculation. Where a deduction is used to calculate gross to net and memo is not. Some example of memos are: Employer match 401k, Group term life (GTL)

nameCode.description: The code of the memo. The code can be user defined or statutory.

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

memoCategoryCode.description: The category of Memo. This is to support Taxable Benefits (memos) in Canada.

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

memoAmount.description: The amount of the memo related to this pay period

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

memoYTDAmount.description: The year to date amount of the memo

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

directDeposits.description: THIS collection is being DEPRECATED.  directDeposits are part of the payDistributions collection.  Direct Deposits will continue going to the directDeposits collection as well as to the payDistributions.  Future new version of this API will drop the directDeposits all together.  A payment that is electronically deposited into an individual's account at a depository institution.

amountValue.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

currencyCode.description: List of standard currency codes ISO 4212

financialPartyRoutingID.description: Identifies the routing number for the financial institution (i.e. bank).  For example, in the US this is the RTN (Routing Transit Number - 9 digit bank code)

financialAccountTypeName.description: The type of account.  For example: Checking, Savings

financialAccountID.description: The Financial Account Number.  This is typically masked

itemID.description: The unique identifier of the related pay distribution within a collection

payrollRegionCode.description: The region in which the payroll is processed

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

longName.description: Long description of the related code

payrollGroupCode.description: The payroll group relevant to payroll processing for this work assignment

longName.description: Long description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

payrollAgreementDescription.description: Payroll Agreement description is a mechanism to provide the user with the job and or position context of a given payroll agreement, e.g. a file number. It should be readable, user-friendly and might be valued with job or position title(s) or perhaps with the work assignment description(s)

requestedStartDate.description: The date when the distribution instruction set will become or became effective.  May not be the same as the first execution date (payroll date)

distributionPurposeCode.description: The pay distribution (transfer) purpose,e.g. Salary, Travel Expenses, Pension Plan, etc.  Client should provide specific code list.  If no value is provided, Salary (payroll) distribution should be assumed

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

effectiveDate.description: The string representation of the date value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

distributionStatusCode.description: The pay distribution status,e.g. Active, Inactive, Pending, etc.  Only one Active distribution should be allowed at any given point of time, while multiple Pending (future) distribution are possible

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

effectiveDate.description: The string representation of the date value. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

distributions.description: Distributions made for this specific pay based on the distribution instructions

itemID.description: The unique identifier of the object in a collection

precedenceCode.description: Indicates the order of precedence for a given distribution, e.g. primary, secondary, etc.

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

paymentMethodCode.description: The method by which the distribution is made, e.g. Direct Deposit, Check, Cash, etc.

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

depositAccount.description: The distribution target, e.g. bank account info

BBAN.description: Basic Bank Account Number. The BBAN format is decided by each national banking community under the restriction that it must be of a fixed length of case-insensitive alphanumeric characters. It includes the domestic bank account number, branch identifier, and potential routing information

IBAN.description: International Bank Account Number. The IBAN consists of up to 34 alphanumeric characters: first the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, then two check digits, and finally a country-specific Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN). The check digits enable a sanity check of the bank account number to confirm its integrity even before submitting a transaction.

UPIC.description: Universal Payment Identification Code. A UPIC is an identifier (or banking address) for a bank account in the United States used to receive electronic credit payments. A UPIC acts exactly like a US bank account number and protects your sensitive banking information. The actual bank account number, including the bank's routing transit number, is masked by the UPIC. Only credit transactions to an account can be initiated with a UPIC. All direct debits are blocked which should mitigate unauthorized transactions to an account.

SWIFTID.description: Identifies a standard format of Business Identifier Codes approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). It is a unique identification code for both financial and non-financial institutions. The acronym SWIFT stands for the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication

financialParty.description: The account where the moneis are to be distributed

financialPartyID.description: The unique identifier of the associated party entity

longName.description: Long description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

scriptCode.description: The type of script the address is in. Associated codelist is ISO15924-A. Use the alpha-4 representation versus the single digit numeric representation. Format is lowercase with inital letter capitalized. For example, Cyrillic is Cyrl

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

lineOne.description: Line One of Street Address Information

lineTwo.description: Line Two of Street Address Information

lineThree.description: Line Three of Street Address Information

lineFour.description: Line Four of Street Address Information

lineFive.description: Line Five of Street Address Information

buildingNumber.description: The number of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. House Number

buildingName.description: The name of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. Rockefeller Center

streetTypeCode.description: The type of street, e.g. Lane, Passage, Way

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

unit.description: A unit in the context of an address, e.g. an Apartment Number or an Office

floor.description: A floor in the context of an address

stairCase.description: A reference to a particular staircase in the context of an address

door.description: A reference to a particular door in the context of an address. e.g. Apartment Number

deliveryPoint.description: A way to identify a specific delivery location, e.g. a mail-stop

plotID.description: A way to identify a building plot, e.g. a specific building construction site

cityName.description: A city in the context of an address

countrySubdivisionLevel1.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level one level below country. For example, in the United States, this would be a state

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

subdivisionType.description: The type of city sub division, e.g. borough, neighborhood

countrySubdivisionLevel2.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level two levels below country. For example, in the United States, this might be a county

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

subdivisionType.description: The type of city sub division, e.g. borough, neighborhood

countryCode.description: The 2 character country code. As per ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2

postalCode.description: The string of characters used to identify the postal code

geoCoordinate.description: The coordinates of the location of the address

latitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth above the equator. (Latitude is negative for a place below the equator.) specified in decimal degrees

longitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth around the equator from the Greenwich Meridian specified in decimal degrees

effectiveDate.description: The date when the current address became effective.  Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format

communication.description: Communication mechanisms, e,g, phone, email, etc

landlines.description: A list of land-line telephone numbers

itemID.description: The unique identifier of the object in a collection

nameCode.description: A coded name or descriptive label of the associated entity. If this is a coded value, codeValue and shortName should be used. If this is just a string value, only shortName is necessary

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code

countryDialing.description: The country dialing code is the national prefix to be used when dialing TO that particular country FROM another country.

areaDialing.description: The local area dialing code for a telephone number.

dialNumber.description: The local communication number, not including country dialing or area dialing codes.   If component parts of the telephone number are being communicated then the dialNumber is required.

extension.description: The extension of the local communication number.  In the case of a Telephone Number accessing a Pager Network, the extension may be the Pager Identification Number required to leave a message for the Pager Number (i.e. Pager Pin).  These are mutually exclusive.

access.description: National Direct Dialing Prefix.  Also known as the trunk prefix or National Prefix.  It is the number to be dialed in a domestic telephone call, preceding any necessary area code and subscriber number (i.e. dial number).  When calling from outside of the country, the national direct dial prefix is omitted by the caller.  In Australia, Germany, and United Kingdom the trunk prefix is 0.  In the US and Canada it is 1.

formattedNumber.description: The formatted telephone number.  The component parts of the telephone are put together into a presentation pattern as defined by the regex format specified.  Please note that \ is used as an escape character in regex, but a double \ is needed to escape within the json schema.  The regex will accept +CC NNNNNNNNNNNNNN where + is the symbol indicating the caller to enter their country specific code to call from outside the country.  CC is the country code for an international number (optional), and the area code and dial number.  The local access code (i.e. 1 (201) 333 4444. 1 is the access code in US) is not passed.  The UI will present the phone number following its own presentation convention

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the related entity. Follows the ISO-8601:2000 format.

mobiles.description: A list of mobile telephone numbers
